WorkItem.Description:
From thread:
http://phpexcel.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=71633
----
Just want to know if i can hide a worksheet with the last version of PHPExcel?
 
 
----
PHPExcel does not notice wheter a sheet is hidden or not. I reads/writes all sheets as unhidden.
 
Requesting functionality like in Excel where it is possible to hide worksheets. You can have "hidden" and "very hidden" worksheets.
 
Quoting from OpenOffice.org's Documentation of the Microsoft Excel File Format sect. 5.95 SHEET
 
"Sheet state:
 
0 = Visible
1 = Hidden
2 = "Very hidden". Can only be set programatically, e.g. with Visual Basic Macro. It is not possible to make such a sheet visible via the user interface
 
End of quote
 
------------
Attaching examples
 
hidden.xls, hidden.xlsx
 
Second sheet is hidden. It can be unhidden again via the user interface
 
 
very-hidden.xls, very-hidden.xlsx
 
Second sheet is very hidden. The very-hidden.xls was actually not created via Visual Basic Macro, but by altering the file in a HEX editor. very-hidden.xlsx is just a saved version of very-hidden.xls
 
 
Enviroment:
----
PHPExcel 1.7.0

Comments.Message: Maarten, is it possible to add support in PHPExcel core for this? Situation for Excel5 is that there is no problem adding support in reader/writer once core supports it.

Implemented for Excel5 (in SVN)

Updating PHPExcel developer documentation
----
Set a worksheet to be hidden using this code:

$objPHPExcel->getActiveSheet()->setSheetState(PHPExcel_Worksheet::SHEETSTATE_HIDDEN);

The available sheet states are :

PHPExcel_Worksheet::SHEETSTATE_VISIBLE
PHPExcel_Worksheet::SHEETSTATE_HIDDEN
PHPExcel_Worksheet::SHEETSTATE_VERYHIDDEN
